intro: Paepalanthus corymbosus, commonly known as the clustered pincushion cactus, is a species native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. It is a low-growing, mat-forming cactus characterized by its dense clusters of cylindrical stems covered in fine, white spines. The plant produces small, yellow flowers during the spring and summer months, which are clustered at the ends of the stems. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and coastal areas. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
